mjw297

Class XicException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • mjw297.XicException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    XicException.EmptyCharacterLiteralException, XicException.IntegerLiteralOutOfBoundsException, XicException.InvalidCharacterConstantException, XicException.InvalidEscapeException, XicException.InvalidHexEscapeException, XicException.InvalidTokenException, XicException.InvalidUnicodeEscapeException, XicException.SyntaxException, XicException.UnclosedCharacterLiteralException, XicException.UnclosedStringLiteralException

    public abstract class XicException
extends java.lang.Exception
    A XicException is an exception that occurs in the Xi compiler. For example, unterminated string literals, invalid integer literals, and invalid escape characters would all throw XicExceptions. Each XicExceptions is accompanied by a unique error code, the row and column where the exception originated, as well as a detailed error message explaining the error. These exceptions can be caught by the main xic program and pretty printed.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
